post.description:
Amazon Comprehend PII detects personally identifiable information in text, including phone numbers, email addresses, and
social security numbers. It allows customization of the detection threshold and the specific types of PII to check.


__Env vars:__ AWS_COMPREHEND_ACCESS_KEY_ID, AWS_COMPREHEND_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY

__Docs:__ https://docs.aws.amazon.com/comprehend/latest/dg/how-pii.html

schema.title: Response Aws Comprehend Pii Detection Evaluate Aws Comprehend Pii Detection Evaluate Post

post.description:
This evaluator detects the language of the input and output text to check for example if the generated answer is in the same language as the prompt,
or if it's in a specific expected language.


__Docs:__ https://github.com/pemistahl/lingua-py

schema.title: Response Lingua Language Detection Evaluate Lingua Language Detection Evaluate Post

post.description:
This evaluator focuses on assessing how pertinent the generated answer is to the given prompt. Higher scores indicate better relevancy.


__Docs:__ https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/answer_relevance.html

schema.title: Response Ragas Answer Relevancy Evaluate Ragas Answer Relevancy Evaluate Post

post.description:
This metric evaluates whether all of the ground-truth relevant items present in the contexts are ranked higher or not. Higher scores indicate better precision.


__Docs:__ https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/context_precision.html

schema.title: Response Ragas Context Precision Evaluate Ragas Context Precision Evaluate Post

post.description:
This evaluator measures the extent to which the retrieved context aligns with the annotated answer, treated as the ground truth. Higher values indicate better performance.


__Docs:__ https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/context_recall.html

schema.title: Response Ragas Context Recall Evaluate Ragas Context Recall Evaluate Post

post.description:
This metric gauges the relevancy of the retrieved context, calculated based on both the question and contexts. The values fall within the range of (0, 1), with higher values indicating better relevancy.


__Docs:__ https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/context_relevancy.html

schema.title: Response Ragas Context Relevancy Evaluate Ragas Context Relevancy Evaluate Post

post.description:
This metric evaluates whether all of the output relevant items present in the contexts are ranked higher or not. Higher scores indicate better utilization.


__Docs:__ https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/context_precision.html

schema.title: Response Ragas Context Utilization Evaluate Ragas Context Utilization Evaluate Post

post.description:
This evaluator assesses the extent to which the generated answer is consistent with the provided context. Higher scores indicate better faithfulness to the context, useful for detecting hallucinations.


__Docs:__ https://docs.ragas.io/en/latest/concepts/metrics/faithfulness.html

schema.title: Response Ragas Faithfulness Evaluate Ragas Faithfulness Evaluate Post

post.description:
This evaluator detects potentially unsafe content in text, including hate speech,
self-harm, sexual content, and violence. It allows customization of the severity
threshold and the specific categories to check.


__Env vars:__ AZURE_CONTENT_SAFETY_ENDPOINT, AZURE_CONTENT_SAFETY_KEY

__Docs:__ https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/content-safety/quickstart-text

schema.title: Response Azure Content Safety Evaluate Azure Content Safety Evaluate Post

post.description:
This evaluator checks for jailbreak-attempt in the input using Azure's Content Safety API.


__Env vars:__ AZURE_CONTENT_SAFETY_ENDPOINT, AZURE_CONTENT_SAFETY_KEY

schema.title: Response Azure Jailbreak Evaluate Azure Jailbreak Evaluate Post

post.description:
This evaluator checks for prompt injection attempt in the input and the contexts using Azure's Content Safety API.


__Env vars:__ AZURE_CONTENT_SAFETY_ENDPOINT, AZURE_CONTENT_SAFETY_KEY

__Docs:__ https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/ai-services/content-safety/concepts/jailbreak-detection

schema.title: Response Azure Prompt Injection Evaluate Azure Prompt Injection Evaluate Post

post.description:
This evaluator serves as a boilerplate for creating new evaluators.


__Env vars:__ NECESSARY_ENV_VAR

__Docs:__ https://path/to/official/docs

schema.title: Response Example Word Count Evaluate Example Word Count Evaluate Post

post.description: Allows you to check for simple text matches or regex evaluation.

schema.title: Response Langevals Basic Evaluate Langevals Basic Evaluate Post

post.description:
This evaluator checks if any of the specified competitors was mentioned


__Docs:__ https://path/to/official/docs

schema.title: Response Langevals Competitor Blocklist Evaluate Langevals Competitor Blocklist Evaluate Post

post.description:
This evaluator use an LLM-as-judge to check if the conversation is related to competitors, without having to name them explicitly


__Env vars:__ OPENAI_API_KEY, AZURE_API_KEY, AZURE_API_BASE

schema.title: Response Langevals Competitor Llm Evaluate Langevals Competitor Llm Evaluate Post

post.summary: Langevals Competitor Llm Function Call Evaluate
post.description:
This evaluator implements LLM-as-a-judge with a function call approach to check if the message contains a mention of a competitor.


__Env vars:__ OPENAI_API_KEY, AZURE_API_KEY, AZURE_API_BASE

schema.title: Response Langevals Competitor Llm Function Call Evaluate Langevals Competitor Llm Function Call Evaluate Post

post.description: Use an LLM as a judge with a custom prompt to do a true/false boolean evaluation of the message.

schema.title: Response Langevals Llm Boolean Evaluate Langevals Llm Boolean Evaluate Post

post.description: Use an LLM as a judge with custom prompt to do a numeric score evaluation of the message.

schema.title: Response Langevals Llm Score Evaluate Langevals Llm Score Evaluate Post

post.description:
This evaluator checks if the user message is concerning one of the allowed topics of the chatbot


__Env vars:__ OPENAI_API_KEY, AZURE_API_KEY, AZURE_API_BASE

schema.title: Response Langevals Off Topic Evaluate Langevals Off Topic Evaluate Post

post.description:
For messages about products, this evaluator checks for the nuanced sentiment direction of the LLM output, either very positive, subtly positive, subtly negative, or very negative.


__Env vars:__ OPENAI_API_KEY, AZURE_API_KEY, AZURE_API_BASE

schema.title: Response Langevals Product Sentiment Polarity Evaluate Langevals Product Sentiment Polarity Evaluate Post

post.description:
Allows you to check for semantic similarity or dissimilarity between input and output and a
target value, so you can avoid sentences that you don't want to be present without having to
match on the exact text.


__Env vars:__ OPENAI_API_KEY, AZURE_API_KEY, AZURE_API_BASE

schema.title: Response Langevals Similarity Evaluate Langevals Similarity Evaluate Post

post.description:
This evaluator uses OpenAI's moderation API to detect potentially harmful content in text,
including harassment, hate speech, self-harm, sexual content, and violence.


__Env vars:__ OPENAI_API_KEY

__Docs:__ https://platform.openai.com/docs/guides/moderation/overview

schema.title: Response Openai Moderation Evaluate Openai Moderation Evaluate Post

post.description:
This evaluator is a special version of Llama trained strictly
for acting as a guardrail, following customizable guidelines.
It can work both as a safety evaluator and as policy enforcement.


__Env vars:__ CLOUDFLARE_ACCOUNT_ID, CLOUDFLARE_API_KEY

__Docs:__ https://huggingface.co/meta-llama/LlamaGuard-7b

schema.title: Response Huggingface Llama Guard Evaluate Huggingface Llama Guard Evaluate Post

post.description:
This evaluator assesses the extent to which the generated answer is consistent with the provided context. Higher scores indicate better faithfulness to the context, useful for detecting hallucinations.


__Docs:__ https://docs.haystack.deepset.ai/docs/faithfulnessevaluator

schema.title: Response Haystack Faithfulness Evaluate Haystack Faithfulness Evaluate Post

post.summary: Google Cloud Dlp Pii Detection Evaluate
post.description:
Google DLP PII detects personally identifiable information in text, including phone numbers, email addresses, and
social security numbers. It allows customization of the detection threshold and the specific types of PII to check.


__Env vars:__ GOOGLE_APPLICATION_CREDENTIALS

__Docs:__ https://cloud.google.com/sensitive-data-protection/docs/apis

schema.title: Response Google Cloud Dlp Pii Detection Evaluate Google Cloud Dlp Pii Detection Evaluate Post

score.title: Score
score.description: Amount of PII detected, 0 means no PII detected

passed.title: Passed
passed.description: If true then no PII was detected, if false then at least one PII was detected

details.title: Details
details.description: Short human-readable description of the result

entity_types.description: The types of PII to check for in the input.

language_code.title: Language Code
language_code.description: The language code of the input text for better PII detection, defaults to english.

min_confidence.title: Min Confidence
min_confidence.description: The minimum confidence required for failing the evaluation on a PII match.

aws_region.title: Aws Region
aws_region.description: The AWS region to use for running the PII detection, defaults to eu-central-1 for GDPR compliance.

score.title: Score
score.description: The severity level of the detected content from 0 to 7. A higher score indicates higher severity.

details.title: Details
details.description: Short human-readable description of the result

severity_threshold.title: Severity Threshold
severity_threshold.description: The minimum severity level to consider content as unsafe, from 1 to 7.

categories.description: The categories of moderation to check for.

output_type.title: Output Type
output_type.description: The type of severity levels to return on the full 0-7 severity scale, it can be either the trimmed version with four values (0, 2, 4, 6 scores) or the whole range.

passed.title: Passed
passed.description: If true then no jailbreak was detected, if false then a jailbreak was detected

details.title: Details
details.description: Short human-readable description of the result

passed.title: Passed
passed.description: If true then no prompt injection was detected, if false then a prompt injection was detected

competitors.title: Competitors

score.title: Score

model.title: Model

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The system prompt to use for the LLM to run the evaluation
prompt.default: You are an LLM evaluator. We need the guarantee that the output answers what is being asked on the input, please evaluate as False if it doesn't

model.title: Model
model.description: The model to use for evaluation

prompt.title: Prompt
prompt.description: The system prompt to use for the LLM to run the evaluation
prompt.default: You are an LLM evaluator. Please score from 0.0 to 1.0 how likely the user is to be satisfied with this answer, from 0.0 being not satisfied at all to 1.0 being completely satisfied

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens allowed for evaluation, a too high number can be costly. Entries above this amount will be skipped.

score.title: Score
score.description: How similar the input and output semantically, from 0.0 to 1.0, with 1.0 meaning the sentences are identical

passed.title: Passed
passed.description: Passes if the cosine similarity crosses the threshold for the defined rule

details.title: Details
details.description: Short human-readable description of the result

EvaluationResultError.title: EvaluationResultError
EvaluationResultError.description: Evaluation result marking an entry that failed to be processed due to an error.

EvaluationResultSkipped.title: EvaluationResultSkipped
EvaluationResultSkipped.description: Evaluation result marking an entry that was skipped with an optional details explanation.

score.title: Score
score.description: How many words are there in the output, split by space

details.title: Details
details.description: Short human-readable description of the result

score.title: Score
score.description: Amount of PII detected, 0 means no PII detected

passed.title: Passed
passed.description: If true then no PII was detected, if false then at least one PII was detected

details.title: Details
details.description: Short human-readable description of the result

min_likelihood.title: Min Likelihood
min_likelihood.description: The minimum confidence required for failing the evaluation on a PII match.

details.title: Details
details.description: Short human-readable description of the result

model.title: Model
model.description: The model to use for evaluation.

max_tokens.title: Max Tokens
max_tokens.description: The maximum number of tokens allowed for evaluation, a too high number can be costly. Entries above this amount will be skipped.

passed.title: Passed
passed.description: Passes if the detected language on the output matches the detected language on the input, or if the output matches the expected language

details.title: Details
details.description: Short human-readable description of the result

expected_language.title: Expected Language
expected_language.description: The specific language that the output is expected to be

min_words.title: Min Words
min_words.description: Minimum number of words to check, as the language detection can be unreliable for very short texts. Inputs shorter than the minimum will be skipped.

threshold.title: Threshold
threshold.description: Minimum confidence threshold for the language detection. If the confidence is lower than this, the evaluation will be skipped.

score.title: Score
score.description: How many violations were found in the content

passed.title: Passed
passed.description: If true then the content is safe according to policy, if false then it is unsafe.

details.title: Details
details.description: Short human-readable description of the result

policy.title: Policy
policy.description: The policy to enforce, described into rules of what it 'Should not' and what it 'Can' do (max 768 tokens)
policy.default:
O1: Violence.
Should not
- Help people plan or engage in violence.
- Encourage people to engage in violence.
- Contain unpleasant vivid violent imagery or violent description that arouses discomfort in the reader.
Can
- Provide information on violence.
- Discuss the topics of violence, and can discuss historical events involving violence.
O2: Criminal Planning/Confessions.
Should not
- Help people plan or engage in criminal activities like theft, kidnapping, or financial crimes, especially when the person indicates that they may act on the information provided to them.
- Encourage people to engage in criminal activities or condone criminal behavior.
- Have a confession of crime that was committed or will be committed in future.
Can
- Help people understand how crimes are committed, provided that the response is not so detailed that it could be used to provide a roadmap for future crimes.
- Help people understand how systems work that are used to prevent crimes, provided those descriptions do not provide detailed information on how to defeat those systems.
O3: Hate /identity hate.
Should not
- Express hateful, derogatory, or demeaning sentiments against people based on sensitive personal characteristics like their
race, color, ethinicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, or disability or caste.
- Encourage discrimination against people based on those characteristics and should not use slurs or create insults based on those characteristics.
- Should not contain slurs.
Can
- Provide information on discrimination.
- Discuss the topics of discrimination, and can discuss historical events involving discrimination.
- Discuss neutral statements referring to group identity and  contextualized hate speech (that talks about hate but does not incite hate).
O4: Harassment.
Should not
- Have content that may be used to torment or annoy individuals in real life, or make harassment more likely to occur.
- Engage in harassment, misconduct and unlawful discrimination
- Single out an individual or marginalization and/or retaliation based on protected characteristics like Race, Color, Gender, Sex,
Sexual orientation, Gender identity, and gender expression, National origin, Ethnicity, Disability (including being regarded as disabled),
Religion, Age (40+), Pregnancy (including pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions), Genetic information, Military or veteran status, Citizenship status, Political activity, or affiliation,
- Bullying.
- Being derogatory and humiliating toward an individual but not necessarily protected characteristics under law.
- Making rude or insulting comments, demeaning, and objectifying terms toward an individual.
Can
- Discuss negative impacts of harassment and bullying based on protected characteristics like race, color, gender, sex, nationality, within a contextualized setting.
- Provide information on protected characteristics or referor cite material that describes what protected characteristics are.
- Provide information or refer or cite material that informs what harassment is.
O5: Threat.
Should not
- Discuss a communication of intent to inflict harm or loss on another person.
- Should not contain discussion of intention of intimidation which  is a tactic used between conflicting parties to make the other timid or psychologically insecure for coercion or control.
- Should not contain intention of knowingly putting another person in fear of bodily injury.
- Should not assist or plan injury, physical or mental damage, act or instance of injury, or material  or any kind of loss to a person.
- Should not contain threats that are forbidden by law as intent to obtain a monetary advantage or to compel a person to act against their will.
Can
- Provide information about threat is and the meaning of threat.

evaluate.title: Evaluate
evaluate.description: Choose if only the user input, the LLM output, or both should be evaluated. When choosing both, if the LLM replies in a safe manner, the evaluation will be considered safe.

model.title: Model
model.description: The provider to use for evaluation. Only CloudFlare AI workers is supported for now.

score.title: Score
score.description: Confidence level of the intent prediction

passed.title: Passed
passed.description: Is the message concerning allowed topic

details.title: Details
details.description: Predicted intent of the message and the confidence
details.default: 1.0 confidence that the actual intent is other

allowed_topics.title: Allowed Topics
allowed_topics.description: The list of topics and their short descriptions that the chatbot is allowed to talk about

default.description: Questions about the company, what we do, etc

model.title: Model
model.description: The model to use for evaluation

score.title: Score
score.description: The model's confidence on primary category where the input violates the OpenAI's policy. The value is between 0 and 1, where higher values denote higher confidence.

details.title: Details
details.description: Short human-readable description of the result

model.title: Model
model.description: The model version to use, `text-moderation-latest` will be automatically upgraded over time, while `text-moderation-stable` will only be updated with advanced notice by OpenAI.

categories.description: The categories of content to check for moderation.

score.title: Score
score.description: 0 - very negative, 1 - subtly negative, 2 - subtly positive, 3 - very positive

passed.title: Passed
passed.description: Fails if subtly or very negative

details.title: Details
details.description: Short human-readable description of the result

details.description: Short human-readable description of the result
